course_title: Strategic Management of Tourism and Events

learning_outcomes.description: Apply key concepts and processes from the strategic management field to tourism and events organisations.
Collaboratively evaluate strategies both at the micro (organisation) level and the macro (destination) level.
Undertake scenario planning in the tourism and events context to develop a future focus.
Apply an understanding of leadership theories, business practices and related ethics in appraising real world issues and events.
Reflect on your own skills and abilities as a future leader in the tourism and events industry.

assessments.due_date:
25/08/2025 - 28/08/2025

This assessment will take place during the scheduled tutorial times for this course.
assessments.task_description:
Creative Connections Whitsundays (CCW) is a volunteer-run community organisation managing the Proserpine Community Art Gallery, which is undergoing a major renovation in FY2025/26. Your group has been engaged to conduct a strategic analysis of the internal (micro) and external (macro) environment in which the Gallery operates, including strategic recommendations to help it thrive as a cultural tourism asset in the Whitsundays.

Your analysis must also consider opportunities for targeted alignment with the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games, appropriate to the Gallery’s scale and resources.

Presentation: Present the analysis and recommendations in class, with feedback provided by classmates in hypothetical roles as the senior management of the tourism or event organisation. Maximum 15 minutes per group.

Peer Assessment Factor for this assessment: Conducted online, at the conclusion of all presentations (% fulfilment of individual role x actual mark awarded to group)

Please Note: The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes.

assessments.task_description:
For this report you will receive a brief scenario of what the travel and tourism industry might look like in 2032, when Brisbane will be hosting the Olympic and Paralympic Games.

Propose a present-day strategy for Brisbane as a tourist destination that will enable tourism and events to thrive in the context of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games, incorporating strategic recommendations developed through a class-based tutorial exercise focused on the redevelopment of Victoria Park/Barrambin.

You should reference the megatrends discussed in this course (technological, economic, societal and environmental changes) in your report.

assessments.task_description:
In Weeks 1 and 2, you will engage in a formative reflection on your leadership aspirations within the tourism and events industry, considering questions such as: What personal and organisational goals will you pursue? This reflection forms the foundation for the summative Week 13 task, where you will reflect on your future as a leader in 2032, addressing four key areas: your leadership development over time, professional leadership experiences, application of course concepts, and how you anticipate and prepare for future industry challenges.
